fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

fields.name: input_message_content
fields.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the video animation

InlineQueryResultVideo.name: InlineQueryResultVideo
InlineQueryResultVideo.description: Represents a link to a page containing an embedded video player or a video file. By default, this video file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the video.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the result, must be video

fields.name: video_height

fields.name: video_duration
fields.description: Optional. Video duration in seconds

fields.name: description
fields.description: Optional. Short description of the result

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

fields.name: input_message_content
fields.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the video. This field is required if InlineQueryResultVideo is used to send an HTML-page as a result (e.g., a YouTube video).

InlineQueryResultLocation.name: InlineQueryResultLocation
InlineQueryResultLocation.description: Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will ignore them.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the result, must be location

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 Bytes

fields.name: latitude

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: Location longitude in degrees

fields.name: title
fields.description: Location title

fields.name: horizontal_accuracy
fields.description: Optional. The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

fields.name: live_period
fields.description: Optional. Period in seconds for which the location can be updated, should be between 60 and 86400.

fields.name: heading
fields.description: Optional. For live locations, a direction in which the user is moving, in degrees. Must be between 1 and 360 if specified.

fields.name: proximity_alert_radius
fields.description: Optional. For live locations, a maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. Must be between 1 and 100000 if specified.

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

fields.name: input_message_content
fields.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the location

fields.name: thumb_width
fields.description: Optional. Thumbnail width

fields.name: thumb_height

fields.name: thumb_height

fields.description: Optional. Additional data about the contact in the form of a vCard, 0-2048 bytes

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

fields.name: input_message_content
fields.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the contact

fields.name: thumb_url
fields.description: Optional. Url of the thumbnail for the result

fields.name: thumb_width
fields.description: Optional. Thumbnail width

fields.name: thumb_height
fields.description: Optional. Thumbnail height

InlineQueryResultGame.name: InlineQueryResultGame
InlineQueryResultGame.description: Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after October 1, 2016. Older clients will not display any inline results if a game result is among them.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the result, must be game

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

fields.name: game_short_name
fields.description: Short name of the game

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

InlineQueryResultCachedPhoto.name: InlineQueryResultCachedPhoto
InlineQueryResultCachedPhoto.description: Represents a link to a photo stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this photo will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the photo.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the result, must be photo

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

fields.name: photo_file_id
fields.description: A valid file identifier of the photo

fields.name: title
fields.description: Optional. Title for the result

fields.name: description
fields.description: Optional. Short description of the result

fields.name: caption
fields.description: Optional. Caption of the photo to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

fields.name: parse_mode
fields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the photo caption. See formatting options for more details.

fields.name: caption_entities
fields.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

fields.name: input_message_content
fields.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the photo

InlineQueryResultCachedGif.name: InlineQueryResultCachedGif
InlineQueryResultCachedGif.description: Represents a link to an animated GIF file stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this animated GIF file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with specified content instead of the animation.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the result, must be gif

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

fields.name: gif_file_id
fields.description: A valid file identifier for the GIF file

fields.name: title
fields.description: Optional. Title for the result

fields.name: caption
fields.description: Optional. Caption of the GIF file to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

fields.name: parse_mode
fields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the caption. See formatting options for more details.

fields.name: caption_entities
fields.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

fields.name: input_message_content
fields.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the GIF animation

InlineQueryResultCachedMpeg4Gif.name: InlineQueryResultCachedMpeg4Gif
InlineQueryResultCachedMpeg4Gif.description: Represents a link to a video animation (H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound) stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this animated MPEG-4 file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the animation.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the result, must be mpeg4_gif

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

fields.name: mpeg4_file_id
fields.description: A valid file identifier for the MPEG4 file

fields.name: title
fields.description: Optional. Title for the result

fields.name: caption
fields.description: Optional. Caption of the MPEG-4 file to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

fields.name: parse_mode
fields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the caption. See formatting options for more details.

fields.name: caption_entities
fields.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

fields.name: input_message_content
fields.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the video animation

InlineQueryResultCachedSticker.name: InlineQueryResultCachedSticker
InlineQueryResultCachedSticker.description: Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016 for static stickers and after 06 July, 2019 for animated stickers. Older clients will ignore them.

fields.name: type

fields.name: reply_markup

fields.name: input_message_content
fields.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the sticker

InlineQueryResultCachedDocument.name: InlineQueryResultCachedDocument
InlineQueryResultCachedDocument.description: Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will ignore them.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the result, must be document

fields.name: id

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title for the result

fields.name: document_file_id
fields.description: A valid file identifier for the file

fields.name: description

fields.name: caption
fields.description: Optional. Caption of the document to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

InlineQueryResultCachedVideo.name: InlineQueryResultCachedVideo
InlineQueryResultCachedVideo.description: Represents a link to a video file stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this video file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the video.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the result, must be video

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

fields.name: video_file_id
fields.description: A valid file identifier for the video file

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title for the result

fields.name: description
fields.description: Optional. Short description of the result

fields.name: caption
fields.description: Optional. Caption of the video to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

fields.name: parse_mode
fields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the video caption. See formatting options for more details.

fields.name: caption_entities
fields.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

fields.name: reply_markup

fields.name: input_message_content

InlineQueryResultCachedVoice.name: InlineQueryResultCachedVoice
InlineQueryResultCachedVoice.description: Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will ignore them.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the result, must be voice

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

fields.name: voice_file_id
fields.description: A valid file identifier for the voice message

fields.name: title
fields.description: Voice message title

fields.name: caption
fields.description: Optional. Caption, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

fields.name: parse_mode
fields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the voice message caption. See formatting options for more details.

fields.name: caption_entities

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

InlineQueryResultCachedAudio.name: InlineQueryResultCachedAudio
InlineQueryResultCachedAudio.description: Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will ignore them.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the result, must be audio

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

fields.name: audio_file_id
fields.description: A valid file identifier for the audio file

fields.name: caption
fields.description: Optional. Caption, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

fields.name: parse_mode
fields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the audio caption. See formatting options for more details.

fields.name: caption_entities

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

fields.name: input_message_content
fields.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the audio

InputMessageContent.name: InputMessageContent
InputMessageContent.description: This object represents the content of a message to be sent as a result of an inline query. Telegram clients currently support the following 5 types:

InputTextMessageContent.name: InputTextMessageContent
InputTextMessageContent.description: Represents the content of a text message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

fields.name: message_text
fields.description: Text of the message to be sent, 1-4096 characters

fields.name: parse_mode
fields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the message text. See formatting options for more details.

fields.name: entities
fields.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in message text, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

fields.name: disable_web_page_preview
fields.description: Optional. Disables link previews for links in the sent message

InputLocationMessageContent.name: InputLocationMessageContent
InputLocationMessageContent.description: Represents the content of a location message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

fields.name: latitude
fields.description: Latitude of the location in degrees

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: Longitude of the location in degrees

fields.name: horizontal_accuracy
fields.description: Optional. The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

fields.name: live_period
fields.description: Optional. Period in seconds for which the location can be updated, should be between 60 and 86400.

fields.name: heading
fields.description: Optional. For live locations, a direction in which the user is moving, in degrees. Must be between 1 and 360 if specified.

fields.name: proximity_alert_radius
fields.description: Optional. For live locations, a maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. Must be between 1 and 100000 if specified.

InputVenueMessageContent.name: InputVenueMessageContent
InputVenueMessageContent.description: Represents the content of a venue message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

fields.name: latitude
fields.description: Latitude of the venue in degrees

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: Longitude of the venue in degrees

fields.name: title
fields.description: Name of the venue

fields.name: address
fields.description: Address of the venue

fields.name: foursquare_id
fields.description: Optional. Foursquare identifier of the venue, if known

fields.name: foursquare_type
fields.description: Optional. Foursquare type of the venue, if known. (For example, “arts_entertainment/default”, “arts_entertainment/aquarium” or “food/icecream”.)

fields.name: google_place_id
fields.description: Optional. Google Places identifier of the venue

fields.name: google_place_type
fields.description: Optional. Google Places type of the venue. (See supported types.)

InputContactMessageContent.name: InputContactMessageContent
InputContactMessageContent.description: Represents the content of a contact message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

fields.name: phone_number
fields.description: Contact's phone number

fields.name: first_name
fields.description: Contact's first name

fields.name: last_name
fields.description: Optional. Contact's last name

fields.name: vcard
fields.description: Optional. Additional data about the contact in the form of a vCard, 0-2048 bytes

InputInvoiceMessageContent.name: InputInvoiceMessageContent
InputInvoiceMessageContent.description: Represents the content of an invoice message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Product name, 1-32 characters

fields.name: description
fields.description: Product description, 1-255 characters

fields.name: payload
fields.description: Bot-defined invoice payload, 1-128 bytes. This will not be displayed to the user, use for your internal processes.

fields.name: provider_token
fields.description: Payment provider token, obtained via @BotFather

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code, see more on currencies

fields.name: prices
fields.description: Price breakdown, a JSON-serialized list of components (e.g. product price, tax, discount, delivery cost, delivery tax, bonus, etc.)

fields.name: max_tip_amount
fields.description: Optional. The maximum accepted amount for tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a maximum tip of US$ 1.45 pass max_tip_amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies). Defaults to 0

fields.name: suggested_tip_amounts
fields.description: Optional. A JSON-serialized array of suggested amounts of tip in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). At most 4 suggested tip amounts can be specified. The suggested tip amounts must be positive, passed in a strictly increased order and must not exceed max_tip_amount.

fields.name: provider_data
fields.description: Optional. A JSON-serialized object for data about the invoice, which will be shared with the payment provider. A detailed description of the required fields should be provided by the payment provider.

fields.name: photo_url
fields.description: Optional. URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service.

fields.name: photo_size
fields.description: Optional. Photo size in bytes

fields.name: photo_width
fields.description: Optional. Photo width

fields.name: photo_height
fields.description: Optional. Photo height

fields.name: need_name
fields.description: Optional. Pass True if you require the user's full name to complete the order

fields.name: need_phone_number
fields.description: Optional. Pass True if you require the user's phone number to complete the order

fields.name: need_email
fields.description: Optional. Pass True if you require the user's email address to complete the order

fields.name: need_shipping_address
fields.description: Optional. Pass True if you require the user's shipping address to complete the order

fields.name: send_phone_number_to_provider
fields.description: Optional. Pass True if the user's phone number should be sent to provider

fields.name: send_email_to_provider
fields.description: Optional. Pass True if the user's email address should be sent to provider

fields.name: is_flexible
fields.description: Optional. Pass True if the final price depends on the shipping method

ChosenInlineResult.name: ChosenInlineResult
ChosenInlineResult.description: Note: It is necessary to enable inline feedback via @BotFather in order to receive these objects in updates.

fields.name: result_id
fields.description: The unique identifier for the result that was chosen

fields.name: from
fields.description: The user that chose the result

fields.name: location
fields.description: Optional. Sender location, only for bots that require user location

fields.name: inline_message_id
fields.description: Optional. Identifier of the sent inline message. Available only if there is an inline keyboard attached to the message. Will be also received in callback queries and can be used to edit the message.

fields.name: query
fields.description: The query that was used to obtain the result

SentWebAppMessage.name: SentWebAppMessage
SentWebAppMessage.description: Your bot can accept payments from Telegram users. Please see the introduction to payments for more details on the process and how to set up payments for your bot. Please note that users will need Telegram v.4.0 or higher to use payments (released on May 18, 2017).

fields.name: inline_message_id
fields.description: Optional. Identifier of the sent inline message. Available only if there is an inline keyboard attached to the message.

LabeledPrice.name: LabeledPrice
LabeledPrice.description: This object represents a portion of the price for goods or services.

fields.name: label
fields.description: Portion label

fields.name: amount
fields.description: Price of the product in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a price of US$ 1.45 pass amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).

Invoice.name: Invoice
Invoice.description: This object contains basic information about an invoice.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Product name

fields.name: description
fields.description: Product description

fields.name: start_parameter
fields.description: Unique bot deep-linking parameter that can be used to generate this invoice

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code

fields.name: total_amount
fields.description: Total price in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a price of US$ 1.45 pass amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).

ShippingAddress.name: ShippingAddress
ShippingAddress.description: This object represents a shipping address.

fields.name: country_code
fields.description: Two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code

fields.name: state
fields.description: State, if applicable

fields.name: city
fields.description: City

fields.name: street_line1
fields.description: First line for the address

fields.name: street_line2
fields.description: Second line for the address

fields.name: post_code
fields.description: Address post code

OrderInfo.name: OrderInfo
OrderInfo.description: This object represents information about an order.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Optional. User name

fields.name: phone_number
fields.description: Optional. User's phone number

fields.name: email
fields.description: Optional. User email

fields.name: shipping_address
fields.description: Optional. User shipping address

ShippingOption.name: ShippingOption
ShippingOption.description: This object represents one shipping option.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Shipping option identifier

fields.name: title
fields.description: Option title

fields.name: prices
fields.description: List of price portions

SuccessfulPayment.name: SuccessfulPayment
SuccessfulPayment.description: This object contains basic information about a successful payment.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code

fields.name: total_amount
fields.description: Total price in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a price of US$ 1.45 pass amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).

fields.name: invoice_payload
fields.description: Bot specified invoice payload

fields.name: shipping_option_id
fields.description: Optional. Identifier of the shipping option chosen by the user

fields.name: order_info
fields.description: Optional. Order information provided by the user

fields.name: telegram_payment_charge_id
fields.description: Telegram payment identifier

fields.name: provider_payment_charge_id
fields.description: Provider payment identifier

ShippingQuery.name: ShippingQuery
ShippingQuery.description: This object contains information about an incoming shipping query.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique query identifier

fields.name: from
fields.description: User who sent the query

fields.name: invoice_payload
fields.description: Bot specified invoice payload

fields.name: shipping_address
fields.description: User specified shipping address

PreCheckoutQuery.name: PreCheckoutQuery
PreCheckoutQuery.description: Telegram Passport is a unified authorization method for services that require personal identification. Users can upload their documents once, then instantly share their data with services that require real-world ID (finance, ICOs, etc.). Please see the manual for details.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique query identifier

fields.name: from
fields.description: User who sent the query

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code

fields.name: total_amount
fields.description: Total price in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a price of US$ 1.45 pass amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).

fields.name: invoice_payload
fields.description: Bot specified invoice payload

fields.name: shipping_option_id
fields.description: Optional. Identifier of the shipping option chosen by the user

fields.name: order_info
fields.description: Optional. Order information provided by the user

PassportData.name: PassportData
PassportData.description: Describes Telegram Passport data shared with the bot by the user.

fields.name: data
fields.description: Array with information about documents and other Telegram Passport elements that was shared with the bot

fields.name: credentials
fields.description: Encrypted credentials required to decrypt the data

PassportFile.name: PassportFile
PassportFile.description: This object represents a file uploaded to Telegram Passport. Currently all Telegram Passport files are in JPEG format when decrypted and don't exceed 10MB.

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

fields.name: file_unique_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: File size in bytes

fields.name: file_date
fields.description: Unix time when the file was uploaded

EncryptedPassportElement.name: EncryptedPassportElement
EncryptedPassportElement.description: Describes documents or other Telegram Passport elements shared with the bot by the user.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Element type. One of “personal_details”, “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”, “address”, “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration”, “temporary_registration”, “phone_number”, “email”.

fields.name: data
fields.description: Optional. Base64-encoded encrypted Telegram Passport element data provided by the user, available for “personal_details”, “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport” and “address” types. Can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

fields.name: phone_number
fields.description: Optional. User's verified phone number, available only for “phone_number” type

fields.name: email
fields.description: Optional. User's verified email address, available only for “email” type

fields.name: files
fields.description: Optional. Array of encrypted files with documents provided by the user, available for “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration” and “temporary_registration” types. Files can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

fields.name: front_side
fields.description: Optional. Encrypted file with the front side of the document, provided by the user. Available for “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card” and “internal_passport”. The file can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

fields.name: reverse_side
fields.description: Optional. Encrypted file with the reverse side of the document, provided by the user. Available for “driver_license” and “identity_card”. The file can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

fields.name: selfie
fields.description: Optional. Encrypted file with the selfie of the user holding a document, provided by the user; available for “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card” and “internal_passport”. The file can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

fields.name: translation
fields.description: Optional. Array of encrypted files with translated versions of documents provided by the user. Available if requested for “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”, “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration” and “temporary_registration” types. Files can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

fields.name: hash
fields.description: Base64-encoded element hash for using in PassportElementErrorUnspecified

EncryptedCredentials.name: EncryptedCredentials
EncryptedCredentials.description: Describes data required for decrypting and authenticating EncryptedPassportElement. See the Telegram Passport Documentation for a complete description of the data decryption and authentication processes.

fields.name: data
fields.description: Base64-encoded encrypted JSON-serialized data with unique user's payload, data hashes and secrets required for EncryptedPassportElement decryption and authentication

fields.name: hash
fields.description: Base64-encoded data hash for data authentication

fields.name: secret
fields.description: Base64-encoded secret, encrypted with the bot's public RSA key, required for data decryption

PassportElementError.name: PassportElementError
PassportElementError.description: This object represents an error in the Telegram Passport element which was submitted that should be resolved by the user. It should be one of:

PassportElementErrorDataField.name: PassportElementErrorDataField
PassportElementErrorDataField.description: Represents an issue in one of the data fields that was provided by the user. The error is considered resolved when the field's value changes.

fields.name: source
fields.description: Error source, must be data

fields.name: type
fields.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the error, one of “personal_details”, “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”, “address”

fields.name: field_name
fields.description: Name of the data field which has the error

fields.name: data_hash
fields.description: Base64-encoded data hash

fields.name: message
fields.description: Error message

PassportElementErrorFrontSide.name: PassportElementErrorFrontSide
PassportElementErrorFrontSide.description: Represents an issue with the front side of a document. The error is considered resolved when the file with the front side of the document changes.

fields.name: source
fields.description: Error source, must be front_side

fields.name: type
fields.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”

fields.name: file_hash
fields.description: Base64-encoded hash of the file with the front side of the document

fields.name: message
fields.description: Error message

PassportElementErrorReverseSide.name: PassportElementErrorReverseSide
PassportElementErrorReverseSide.description: Represents an issue with the reverse side of a document. The error is considered resolved when the file with reverse side of the document changes.

fields.name: source
fields.description: Error source, must be reverse_side

fields.name: type
fields.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “driver_license”, “identity_card”

fields.name: file_hash
fields.description: Base64-encoded hash of the file with the reverse side of the document

fields.name: message
fields.description: Error message

PassportElementErrorSelfie.name: PassportElementErrorSelfie
PassportElementErrorSelfie.description: Represents an issue with the selfie with a document. The error is considered resolved when the file with the selfie changes.

fields.name: source
fields.description: Error source, must be selfie

fields.name: type
fields.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”

fields.name: file_hash
fields.description: Base64-encoded hash of the file with the selfie

fields.name: message
fields.description: Error message

PassportElementErrorFile.name: PassportElementErrorFile
PassportElementErrorFile.description: Represents an issue with a document scan. The error is considered resolved when the file with the document scan changes.

fields.name: source
fields.description: Error source, must be file

fields.name: type
fields.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration”, “temporary_registration”

fields.name: file_hash
fields.description: Base64-encoded file hash

fields.name: message
fields.description: Error message

PassportElementErrorFiles.name: PassportElementErrorFiles
PassportElementErrorFiles.description: Represents an issue with a list of scans. The error is considered resolved when the list of files containing the scans changes.

fields.name: source
fields.description: Error source, must be files

fields.name: type
fields.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration”, “temporary_registration”

fields.name: file_hashes
fields.description: List of base64-encoded file hashes

fields.name: message

getUpdates.name: getUpdates
getUpdates.description: Use this method to receive incoming updates using long polling (wiki). Returns an Array of Update objects.

fields.name: offset
fields.description: Identifier of the first update to be returned. Must be greater by one than the highest among the identifiers of previously received updates. By default, updates starting with the earliest unconfirmed update are returned. An update is considered confirmed as soon as getUpdates is called with an offset higher than its update_id. The negative offset can be specified to retrieve updates starting from -offset update from the end of the updates queue. All previous updates will forgotten.

fields.name: limit
fields.description: Limits the number of updates to be retrieved. Values between 1-100 are accepted. Defaults to 100.

fields.name: timeout
fields.description: Timeout in seconds for long polling. Defaults to 0, i.e. usual short polling. Should be positive, short polling should be used for testing purposes only.

fields.name: allowed_updates
fields.description: A JSON-serialized list of the update types you want your bot to receive. For example, specify [“message”, “edited_channel_post”, “callback_query”] to only receive updates of these types. See Update for a complete list of available update types. Specify an empty list to receive all update types except chat_member (default). If not specified, the previous setting will be used.Please note that this parameter doesn't affect updates created before the call to the getUpdates, so unwanted updates may be received for a short period of time.

setWebhook.name: setWebhook
setWebhook.description: If you'd like to make sure that the webhook was set by you, you can specify secret data in the parameter secret_token. If specified, the request will contain a header “X-Telegram-Bot-Api-Secret-Token” with the secret token as content.

fields.name: url
fields.description: HTTPS URL to send updates to. Use an empty string to remove webhook integration

fields.name: certificate
fields.description: Upload your public key certificate so that the root certificate in use can be checked. See our self-signed guide for details.

fields.name: ip_address
fields.description: The fixed IP address which will be used to send webhook requests instead of the IP address resolved through DNS

fields.name: max_connections
fields.description: The maximum allowed number of simultaneous HTTPS connections to the webhook for update delivery, 1-100. Defaults to 40. Use lower values to limit the load on your bot's server, and higher values to increase your bot's throughput.

fields.name: allowed_updates
fields.description: A JSON-serialized list of the update types you want your bot to receive. For example, specify [“message”, “edited_channel_post”, “callback_query”] to only receive updates of these types. See Update for a complete list of available update types. Specify an empty list to receive all update types except chat_member (default). If not specified, the previous setting will be used.Please note that this parameter doesn't affect updates created before the call to the setWebhook, so unwanted updates may be received for a short period of time.

fields.name: drop_pending_updates
fields.description: Pass True to drop all pending updates

fields.name: secret_token
fields.description: A secret token to be sent in a header “X-Telegram-Bot-Api-Secret-Token” in every webhook request, 1-256 characters. Only characters A-Z, a-z, 0-9, _ and - are allowed. The header is useful to ensure that the request comes from a webhook set by you.

deleteWebhook.name: deleteWebhook
deleteWebhook.description: Use this method to remove webhook integration if you decide to switch back to getUpdates. Returns True on success.

fields.name: drop_pending_updates
fields.description: Pass True to drop all pending updates

getWebhookInfo.name: getWebhookInfo
getWebhookInfo.description: Use this method to get current webhook status. Requires no parameters. On success, returns a WebhookInfo object. If the bot is using getUpdates, will return an object with the url field empty.

getMe.name: getMe
getMe.description: A simple method for testing your bot's authentication token. Requires no parameters. Returns basic information about the bot in form of a User object.

logOut.name: logOut
logOut.description: Use this method to log out from the cloud Bot API server before launching the bot locally. You must log out the bot before running it locally, otherwise there is no guarantee that the bot will receive updates. After a successful call, you can immediately log in on a local server, but will not be able to log in back to the cloud Bot API server for 10 minutes. Returns True on success. Requires no parameters.

close.name: close
close.description: Use this method to close the bot instance before moving it from one local server to another. You need to delete the webhook before calling this method to ensure that the bot isn't launched again after server restart. The method will return error 429 in the first 10 minutes after the bot is launched. Returns True on success. Requires no parameters.

sendMessage.description: Use this method to send text messages. On success, the sent Message is returned.

fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

fields.name: message_thread_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only

fields.name: text
fields.description: Text of the message to be sent, 1-4096 characters after entities parsing

fields.name: parse_mode
fields.description: Mode for parsing entities in the message text. See formatting options for more details.

fields.name: disable_web_page_preview
fields.description: Disables link previews for links in this message

fields.name: disable_notification
fields.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

fields.name: protect_content
fields.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving

fields.name: reply_to_message_id
fields.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

fields.name: allow_sending_without_reply
fields.description: Pass True if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard, custom reply keyboard, instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

A quiz poll can be copied only if the value of the field correct_option_id is known to the bot. The method is analogous to the method forwardMessage, but the copied message doesn't have a link to the original message. Returns the MessageId of the sent message on success.
